Sentencas: A series of Ni doped SrNixFe12-xO19 (x = 0.0, 0.05, 0.10, 0.15, 0.20, 0.25) hexaferrites were fabricated through facile micro-emulsion approach and doping content effect was investigated based on structural, dielectric, optical and photocatalytic properties.
Titulo: Ni doped SrFe12O19 nanoparticles synthesized via micro-emulsion route and photocatalytic activity evaluation for the degradation of crystal violet under visible light irradiation

Sentencas: The prepared materials were characterized via X-ray diffraction (XRD), Raman, Fourier transformed infrared (FTIR), photoluminescence (PL) and UV-vis techniques.
Titulo: Ni doped SrFe12O19 nanoparticles synthesized via micro-emulsion route and photocatalytic activity evaluation for the degradation of crystal violet under visible light irradiation

Sentencas: The Ni doped SrFe12O19 structure was hexagonal having space group P63/mmc with mean crystallite size in 34-50 nm range.
Titulo: Ni doped SrFe12O19 nanoparticles synthesized via micro-emulsion route and photocatalytic activity evaluation for the degradation of crystal violet under visible light irradiation

Sentencas: Ferroelectric polarization, coercivity and Remnant polarizations were increased with Ni doping.
Titulo: Ni doped SrFe12O19 nanoparticles synthesized via micro-emulsion route and photocatalytic activity evaluation for the degradation of crystal violet under visible light irradiation

Sentencas: Dielectric analysis showed the higher values of dielectric parameters with dispersion in low frequency region, which were independent of at high frequency.
Titulo: Ni doped SrFe12O19 nanoparticles synthesized via micro-emulsion route and photocatalytic activity evaluation for the degradation of crystal violet under visible light irradiation

Sentencas: Optical bandgap was reduced on substitution, which was in 2.31-1.66 eV range, which was in good association with decline in PL analysis.
Titulo: Ni doped SrFe12O19 nanoparticles synthesized via micro-emulsion route and photocatalytic activity evaluation for the degradation of crystal violet under visible light irradiation

Sentencas: The PCA (photocatalytic activity) of pure SrFe12O19 (SFO) and doped SFNO5 (x = 0.25) material was assessed for removal of crystal violet (CV) dye under visible light illu-mination.
Titulo: Ni doped SrFe12O19 nanoparticles synthesized via micro-emulsion route and photocatalytic activity evaluation for the degradation of crystal violet under visible light irradiation

Sentencas: The SFNO5 showed much better PCA and 91 % dye was removed in 90 min with a rate constant of 2.337 x 10-2 min-1 versus pristine SFO (only 55 % with rate constant 8.02 x 10-3 min-1).
Titulo: Ni doped SrFe12O19 nanoparticles synthesized via micro-emulsion route and photocatalytic activity evaluation for the degradation of crystal violet under visible light irradiation

Sentencas: Results revealed that tuned bandgap and enhanced AC conductivity of doped materials make it crucial candidates for optoelectronic and SOFCs (Solid oxide fuel cell) applications.
Titulo: Ni doped SrFe12O19 nanoparticles synthesized via micro-emulsion route and photocatalytic activity evaluation for the degradation of crystal violet under visible light irradiation

Sentencas: Owing to the excellent PCA and magnetically separable nature, SrNixFe12-xO19 has potential for the dyes removal from the effluents under solar light irradiation, which could be more economically versus UV based photocatalytic process.
Titulo: Ni doped SrFe12O19 nanoparticles synthesized via micro-emulsion route and photocatalytic activity evaluation for the degradation of crystal violet under visible light irradiation
